Posts.Content: Hi Winky49 Hot flushes are awful at work aye! I work it a hot stuffy factory! Machines everywhere, that give off heat!! We have to wear thick cotton overalls & hair nets!!  I work nights so by morning I look a mess!  I really feel for you and I hope you get things sorted. They certainly don’t sound a very sympathetic or friendly bunch in your office! Good Luck in keeping your own office  Julie xx
Posts.Title: What can I do???

Posts.Content: Thank you @earwig o Oh I know how lightly I’ve got off with this s%@t disease. Thanks @Snowys Mum & trust me in my own head I know how different things could have been.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Thank you so much @Leolady56.  On my 2nd beer   Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Thank you @ali owl  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Hey thanks @Weeblemum    Loving the fireworks!  Just having a Cold beer in the sun to celebrate    Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Thank you @Eddieboy. Yes BCN said it’s rare but a “good” one to get.....if there’s a good one TO get!  Thank you @SFG529 Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Thank you @seaspirit44 You will do   Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Morning All  At last good news Grade 1 Invasive Tubular Cancer 21mm tumour removed, Clear Margins.....Lymph Nodes (2 removed) Clear.....er positive!  Treatment Plan: 3 Weeks Radiotherapy & Hormone Tablets 5-10 years Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Hey Sal! He sure did  with LP!!  Thank you   Yes looking forward to Birmingham and meeting up!  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Thank you @Flossie25  Thank you @Moomc a relatively easy journey compared so some. Might even have a beer or 2 tonight!   Fingers crossed for your results next weeks  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Thank you Laura & @moomy Julie xx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Evening All  Been asked today what my Oncotype DX test result was.  I was diagnosed last month with Stage 1 (Grade wasn’t mentioned) Tubular Breast Cancer. 2.1cm tumour & 2 Sentinel Nodes removed, clear margins and nodes clear. ER positive. That is all I know....awaiting oncologist appointment for hormone tablets & 15 lots of Radiotherapy.  What is the Oncotype DX test & would I have had it done?  Thanks in advance Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Thank you @mistymoley  I obviously didn’t need it as nothing was mentioned to me when I went for results. Although I hadn’t even heard of it, you think you’ve  read up on everything and something else pops up lol.  Thanks again Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Hi @Jacmatholmad  That’s something else that keeps popping up & not been mentioned to me, this Ki 67 score lol. Feel so naive & I haven’t been asking the right questions.  Suppose all I can do is wait for my oncology appointment and see what they have to say.  Don’t get me wrong I’m happy to go along with the surgeon and have Radiotherapy & Hormone Tablets.  Just wish they would tell you everything.  Thanks Jacmathomad Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Yea that’s the thing @Jacmatholmad there’s way to much info out there, so them giving us the watered down results don’t help when, like me you like to know, to get back that little bit of control.  I guess I’ll have to write a few questions down for when I see the Oncologist. Just to put my mind at rest.  Thanks for your input  it was very helpful.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Ah Thanks for that Cathy. I know when I first got results I looked into Tubular and it did say that not many Tubular cancers were “true” Tubular but it never really explained what it meant.  I was beginning to wonder if I’d had 2 tumours that were different and they’d failed to tell me lol Thanks again  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Different Diagnosis??

Posts.Content: Thanks Moomc  Yea I’m pretty new, I was diagnosed 10th April, seems such a long time ago now!!  I feel quite lucky to escape chemo....I know it could have been so much worse!  Fingers & toes crossed for you for tomorrow. Let me know how it goes.  Big hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Hey @Flossie25  Good Luck with your op today  Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Dreamthief  an extra 10 hours a week seems do’able, it’s the transition from days to night shift I’m worried about....getting back into a sleep pattern etc. HR didn’t want me doing a full 8 hours on nights anyway so she agreed to 6. I suppose I’m not gonna know until I do it.  I work in a factory as Quality Control, so not really physical but I was helping on the line, packing etc which is when I was getting the aches/pains so maybe my fault for doing to much lol.  In my push for ‘normal’ am I rushing things? Something for me to think about. Must admit it’s nice to have some sort of normality back, even if I am rushing it  Thanks for the advice & suggestions Julie xx
Posts.Title: First week back at work completed!!

Posts.Content: Thank you!!  Oh I intend to Julie xx
Posts.Title: First week back at work completed!!

Posts.Content: Well I made the decision and I’ve completed my 1st week back at work!!  I felt like the new kid walking into a new school  I was so nervous!! After Hugs all round & hundreds of questions it wasn’t as bad as I expected   I’m doing part time (4 hours a day) for a couple of weeks but I didn’t expect to feel so tired every day! Some jobs made my arm and boob ache/hurt...the hot flushes & sweats are bloody embarrassing   1 step on the road to normality done    Big hugs to everyone Julie xx
Posts.Title: First week back at work completed!!

Posts.Content: Thank you Moomc   I wasn’t looking forward to going back but must admit I feel better in myself now I’m back.  Aww sorry about your redundancy Mandy  not what you need after all this poop aye. I hope next year is a better year for you   Thats the hard bit Mandy, learning to be selfish & looking after number 1.....I’m getting better at it, already starting to say ‘no’ to jobs at work if I think it’s too much for me.  I hope you’re feeling ok in yourself Bigs Hugs Mandy.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: First week back at work completed!!

Posts.Content: Thanks for that @Sortitoutkids (love the name lol)  Still don’t get why some people get this test as a lot of bc seem to be eligible but don’t have it.......it’s been a long day I’m tired, in a bit of pain & my brain doesn’t seem to want to work today. :-/  Thanks again   Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Hi all  Silly question but has anyone been diagnosed 2 types of BC?  Basically when I went for my results after a WLE & SNB I was told “21mm Stage 1 Invasive TUBULAR Carcinoma ER +”.  Yesterday I received a copy of the letter that goes to GP etc and that stated “21mm Stage 1 Invasive DUCTAL Carcinoma ER+”   Does Anybody know why they were different BCs & has anyone else had this?  Thanks Julie xx
Posts.Title: Different Diagnosis??

Posts.Content: Hi @moomc Ah right so it’s not a standard test then? Or for certain cancers? Should I ask when I see the Oncologist? Yea they said mine was slow growing although invasive and that Tubular was one of the “better” ones to have.  I was just confused as I hadn’t heard of this test.  Always something new to learn with this crap aye! Lol Thank you & Good Luck with your results tomorrow xx Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Thanks @Dreamthief  Lol! Oh I’m fine to go along with the Surgeon has recommended & hopefully the Oncologist.   :-))  Someone ask me what my results were for this test and I knew nothing about it, didn’t know what it was or why it was done, hence this question.  This is a whole new world for me until 5 weeks ago I didn’t even know how many different BC there was!  Thanks for the info though I’ll have a read through   Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Hi Moomc  Thank you.....strange as I was diagnosed Invasive BC Stage 1 21mm tumour no nodes involved & ER Positive her2 Negative.  You think you’ve got your head round things then something else pops up lol.  Oh well I’ll happily take my surgeons word that all I’ll need is rads & Hormone Tablets  Thanks Moomc take care x Julie xx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Thank you seaspirit44  Morning Dreamthief I have a meeting next Friday to see how I’m doing. I normally work the night shift (doing 10am - 2pm at the minute) I’m sure they’ll want me back on nights but doing 6 hours (10pm till 4am) which I’m fine about but am I pushing it?  Julie xx
Posts.Title: First week back at work completed!!

Posts.Content: Hi all I noticed Middle of last week I was struggling to hold my breath during RT zaps, felt like I couldn’t take a deep enough breath, and now the past few days I’ve developed a dry cough and feel breathless. Is this normal?  Should I mention it tomorrow? It’s my last Zap tomorrow.  Thanks julie xx
Posts.Title: Breathlessness & Dry Cough

Posts.Content: Leolady56  Thank You no never experienced it before. I’ll mention it in the morning.  I’ll be back tomorrow saying PHEW silly me Lol    Thanks again  julie xx
Posts.Title: Breathlessness & Dry Cough

Posts.Content: Leolady56 took your advice although I didn’t have to mention the cough, they heard me lol. I’ve got to give it till the end of the week & see how how I am  and then see my go.  Ive ring that bell  all done till April next year   Thanks again  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Breathlessness & Dry Cough

Posts.Content: Hi HappyFeet1  Time to take it easy now and look after yourself   Hopefully you won’t have to long a wait to see Oncologist and start RT.  Good Luck Julie xx
Posts.Title: how long off work after lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Hi HappyFeet1  I was in exactly the same position as you are 7 months ago....my job involves a lot of lifting, heavy handling and moving pallets, I was initially going to take 6-8 weeks off but I didn’t feel mentally ready to go back so ended up staying off almost 5 months (about 5 weeks after RT had finished) & then went back on a phase return. I’ve now been back full time for 3 weeks.  I struggle to be selfish & felt guilty for being off work when I felt ok, but you do have to take time for yourself. Although RT is nowhere near as bad as Chemo it’s can still leave you feeling really tired.  Take some you time :)  Bug Hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: how long off work after lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Excellent news!  Sleep is good....listen to your body & rest up.  Hope you’re feeling better soon Gentle hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: Home after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi @Frillyflower I finished work the day before my op. BCN told me to have 6 weeks on sick as my job involves a lot of lifting & pushing/pulling pallets.  I work nights so it’s kinda hard to judge going work around appointments/Radiotherapy etc so I’m not going back until a couple of weeks after my Radiotherapy.  I found it hard working whilst waiting for results as couldn’t concentrate and I need to pay attention as machinery is involved so staying on the sick is the best thing for me and work have been great to be fair  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi @Frillyflower I was diagnosed on 10th April and they originally said my tumour was 2.5/3cm. I had surgery 26th April tumour was removed with clear margins and no lymph nodes infected. Tumour was 2.1cm er positive.  I’m now awaiting to see oncologist for about 3 weeks Radiotherapy and then hormone tablets for 5-10years.  I couldn’t eat or sleep & It’s very natural to worry & the waiting is horrible. Since I got full results and treatment plan I’ve felt so much better! I’ve still got a few rough weeks/months but when my surgeon said at the beginning it’s treatable I can now believe her and feel confident that I can do this, and as time goes on you’ll get to this stage.  I live by myself and know exactly how you feel about imagining all sorts when you’re by yourself.  I coped by reading on here about things and arming myself with as much information as possible. I hope your feel better soon. You can do this ;-)  Bigs hugs  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Morning @Frillyflower & Welcome   Similar diagnosis to me. Recalled from a routine mammogram, had another mammogram, ultrasound & biopsies, Diagnosed 2.1cm invasive tubular Breast Cancer, very treatable. Had WLE & SNB 2 weeks later. I’m now waiting to see oncologist for Radiotherapy....and this all happened in April!!  The waiting is the worse bit....waking up in the night seems to be the norm for most people on here I’m afraid, I tend to have a bottle of water or juice at side of bed, snacks and a good series on Netflix lol.  Good Luck with your treatment.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: The waiting it bad I must admit! I was terrible waiting for my biopsy results....the poor people I worked with, I was snappy and really short tempered! I was so glad to go home to be honest. I was fine the run up to my op, strange but I wasn’t worried about that lol.  I’m glad I’ve chosen to to stay off to be honest, I feel a lot more calmer now and getting more use out of my are so can potter around the house doing those jobs that never get done lol.  I just want to hurry up and get Radiotherapy done with and try and get back to some sort of  ‘normal’ life.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed 10th April....Go in Thursday morning for WLE & SNB.....Apart from a couple tearful, mini break downs...I’ve been my usual happy go lucky “normal” self. Which quite a few people can’t understand! Saying I’m weird & not accepting that I’ve got Cancer! In denial!  Yes I have Breast Cancer but I’m not gonna lay down and feel sorry for myself.  Does anyone else feel like this or am I weird?  Julie xx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Awww bless ya  Yes hard decision to make! I feel for you Coll   I’ve been to a work mates funeral today and got another one Friday, a lady I used to work with who had to retire due to having BC (which is a bit close to home).  Had to face a few work colleagues who didn’t know about my BC and thought I’d been on the sick with flu!! It’s a big factory so I assumed most people knew!  I’m just in a funny mood waiting for my results from my WLE & SNB, which I had done 26th April!! I see the Surgeon 23rd May!! I just wanna know what’s what & get started on treatment.  Sorry for the rant   Hope you’re feeling better  Julie xx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Good Morning Coll Not a bad night for me lol woke up about 2ish, watched a film nodded back off about 5ish, which to be fair it quite normal for me lol.  Yes I really need to learn to chill & switch off. Think I’ll be better once I’ve got final results next week and know what my treatment plan is.  Hope you’re feeling better this morning. Sounds like you had a rough night! Good luck with onco team fingers crossed they give you a go! That’s what all of us want at the end of the day, get rid of this crap and try and get back to a normal life.  I’ve just Grandson school (Daighter taking advantage of me being on sick lol) so relaxing with a coffee and then off out later with family for my birthday meal.   You take care Love & hugs back at ya!   Julie xx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Hi All  Lumpectomy & Sentinel Node Biopsy all done yesterday....wasn’t as traumatic as I thought it would be! Despite feeling dizzy & sick from the minute I came round from the anaesthetic I still came home last night and slept the whole night!! Bit sore & tender today!   Consultant didn’t say how Op went just that I’d get the full results in 4 weeks time!! The waiting game starts again
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Big Hugs back at ya @Dizzy17  I’m feeling shitty today too!  Julie xx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: I just assumed they all knew...feel really bad when I have to tell them...bless them they’re lost for words and don’t know what to say, I work in a sweet factory (not good for the waistline lol).  I popped in last week to hand my sick note in and everyone was lovely   I’m not a very patient person and the waiting for results etc is driving me crazy lol  Thank you unless you’ve going or been through BC friends family etc don’t get what you’re going through.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: Leolady56 it was the first thing I asked lol. I was told a bath was fine but only warm water. I love a good soak in the bath with a book   i was told no swimming for 2/3 weeks after last Zap but I saw on here others had been told it was fine lol so yes definitely mixed messages.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Afternoon All Hope everyone’s holding up ok. Thats another one ticked off!! Very pink today, little bit sore and tired!  Did a very silly thing yesterday  went for a drink with my niece after Zap....hot and stuffy in the bar and I totally forgot and sprayed body spray on my neck & chest!!!! Jeez thought my skin was on fire! Had to tip cold water down my top to try and wash it off! I did look a state   Won’t be doing that again in a hurry.  Gentle hugs to everyone  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hey youngandfit Thanks for that. I just assumed the blue one was the baby one....so thanks for that I’ll check amazon out   Yes I’m hoping I’m not out the swimming pool for to long.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Got given a basic booklet that explained about ct planning &  Radiotherapy oh and about the breathing if it’s left breast. To be fair it felt like my oncologist was reading from a script....told me about SE from Tamoxifen & the increase risk of womb cancer after I’d just told him I’d had an Hysterectomy!  I had 3 nurses/radiologist doing my planning and all I got told was about E45 & moisturisering. It’s a good job I’d read on here about going with bare/clean skin or I’d have put deodorant, body lotion and perfume on tomorrow!  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hey All  1st Zap yesterday, wasn’t to bad. Was on the machine for about 25 minutes (zapped for about 15) Did the breathing fine *phew* Nipple and scar was a bit sore last night but think that was my fault from rubbing lotion on a bit to rough LOL!  Seen a really nice radiographer 1st and got loads more info from her. Main ones were take this easy for 3 weeks after, treat it as if you’re still having treatment. Keep top half covered up and out the sun! NO swimming for 3 weeks after and It’s ok to have a bath, all be it a warm one! YAY!   Hope everyone’s feeling good and treatment going ok take care  julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: My appointment times are rubbish as well! Asked for mid morning, 1st week I’ve got between 2.30pm & 3.30pm after that they range from 11.30am to 2.50pm!  I’m traveling by bus so just been and got a monthly bus pass today LOL!!  Getting a bit nervous now. Will take each day as it comes.... Good luck to all starting and who have already started.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Wow YoungandFit apart from not using my normal body lotion (Soap & Glory) I’ve been told nothing. When I asked any dos and don’ts all I was told was plenty of moisturiser ie E45. julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Vespa73 & Welcome to the RT train   I’m just off for Zap 4, nipple and scar are a bit sore and pink but bearable (I take my bra/crop top off as soon as I get home!) as for shrinkage at the minute mine is a bit swollen, actually looks a bit bigger than the ‘normal’ one lol.  But yea I’m Hoping it doesn’t shrink even more! I had quite a dent in mine from lumpectomy.  As for skin little and often moisturiser was the advice I was given.  Good luck  julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Evening Ladies! had Zap no 6 today.....boob a light pinky/purple colour & white blisters around the nipple, which is a bit sore but nothing major.....YET *fingers crossed* bit tired tonight so warm bath and early night for me.  Hope everyones holding up ok.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Yes guys avoid body sprays/perfume on RT site   julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: My niece was exactly the same Mandy  She was in fits lol.  Must admit I was afterwards....sitting there in a wet tshirt (thank god it wasn’t white!)   Hows you holding up Moomc julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: ah Makes sense now.....I just thought my previously diagnosed ulcer & hiatus hernia had started playing up again lol didn’t realise it was the meds.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and indigestion.

Posts.Content: Morning ladies I’m glad my little accident cheered everyone up  only me could do that  Moomc   skin seem to be holding up ok....pink & sore and a few blister around nipple but they all calm down by the morning so fingers crossed. Glad yours isn’t too bad  Good luck for today x Israel  the cold water and a bath when I got home calmed it down, no ill effects   Ouch! Poor you, that’s all you need when sore anyway! Good Luck for today x AnjelB  I wasn’t told either way about ice/cold packs. I got some Aloe Vera gel in just in case (think I paid £2.99 for Holland & Barrett’s), I’d seen other people mention it. Keep it in the fridge, it’ll be nice and cold then for when you need it. Good Luck for today x julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hey All  I start Radiotherapy Monday 9th July & finish 30th July! I’ve got E45 lotion, Aveeno moisturisering lotion Blue (the baby one lol) and Aloe Vera Gel! Also brought Simple shower gel and Bath Creme (yea I know we’re not suppose to bath lol but I love a lay in the bath)  I’m sure they’ll be something I’ve forgot lol.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Clare  It’s on offer at the moment in Boots   I got mine Friday.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Moomc Glad it went ok, fingers crossed it stays that way for you   My 1st one Monday, I’m still a bit nervous, I’ll be fine once I’ve had one zap cause then I’ll know what to expect. Mines left side so I’ve gotta do the deep breath holding lol.  Well my last 2 days enjoying the sun and it’s Football Day so tv in the garden with a few cold beers :)  have a great weekend Mandy  Take care & we’ll speak soon Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Morning Mandy   i was a bit pink last night but it’s gone down now and my scar aches for a few hours then goes off....sign of things to come aye!  Fingers crossed for everyone today  oh and for the ENGLAND team   sorry lol  julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Yay!!!!   Moomc  & Israel  Well Done Ladies    Ive just got Monday and I’m done Big Hugs Ladies  julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Clare Yes I’m enjoying the sun while I still can lol.  I didn’t know there were so many Aveeno creams, When I saw on here people mentioning the blue one and I saw the babies on in offer I just assumed this was the one. Oh well it can’t be that bad if it’s meant for babies lol.  I hope you RT goes well  Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: I’m a bit worried about the breathing part Moomc I didn’t struggle or anything, I’m just worried about it for some reason lol. How many times did you have to do it?  Thanks :)  my appointments at 3.20.  Good of luck to you to Mandy  julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy Moomc I’ve  got an extra appointment on Monday for a review and then an extra one on Zap 14 for a clinic visit but no skin or physio. I’m in the Midlands.  2 down 13 to go :)  The hardest part at the minute is staying out the Sun.  Gentles hugs everyone  julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Well Guys I’m done!!!  I rang that bell hard   (at the instance of my 5 yr old Grandson lol)  Must admit it was quite emotional! After thanking the staff etc I met my kids in the pub for a couple of   And now I’d  like to THANK you guys for helping me on this short but hard journey   Thank You All & Good Luck to those still on this journey  Big hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: It was rang loud and proud! Its been quite an emotional day  Big Hugs to everyone still fighting this crap Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hey HClare Congratulations!! Well Done on finishing RT! Feels good doesn’t it Good Luck to everyone still on their journeys  Hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Wow!! Absolutely brilliant   I love this. You’ve just put into words exactly how I’m feeling! Made me tear up Thank you Julie xx
Posts.Title: The BC Paradox and a Thank you

Posts.Content: Hi KEM63 I’ve found the same thing with me only my offers of help/visits diminished a couple of days after having my WLE & SNB (I still have Radiotherapy to go through!).....i have a handful of friends that actually text or ring to enquire how I am and a couple that come and see me.  It’s certainly opened my eyes!  Hope you’re doing well  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Deminishing support

Posts.Content: I was going to try and get an appointment with my gp and ask about these creams once I’d seen Oncologist tomorrow....I’ve heard they don’t give them very easily lol. I’ve got E45 and aloe Vera gel just in case lol.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Deminishing support

Posts.Content: Hi K You certainly do! Definitely, hold on to the ones that have stuck around.  Thank you  and to be honest I’ve always moisturised daily anyway....it’s just now I can’t use my usual body lotions (Soap & Glory or Dove lol) I’m using E45 daily at the minute as recommended by my Surgeon but I’ll double check on Tuesday and RT planning meeting.   Thanks for the tips Julie xx
Posts.Title: Deminishing support

Posts.Content: Thank you Violetsniff it’s hardly stopped today! A Walk for my last Radiotherapy tomorrow it will be then....bring the summer back lol. X Eddiboy we get loads of them down the canal near us. X
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thanks....I  work nights seaspirit44 and it’s taking a while to get back to sleeping in the day time! Only getting 2/3 hours sleep so pushed myself to go swimming Julie xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Afternoon All well ive braved it and finally been swimming! Had to buy a bigger swimsuit due to weight gain   Swam for about 20/25 mins before I was knackered and boob and armpit was sore & pulling but was quite pleased with myself.....now to keep it up   Gonna try and aim for 3 times a week. Hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: I love walking down the canal watching these beauties. Gutted it’s raining today ( I hate the rain & cold weather lol)  I would have walked to the pub for Sunday lunch
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thank you so much Eddiboy Yes we have a bell & I shall be ringing it  I have 3 weeks left on sick note so hopefully if the sun comes back I shall do   Thank You again  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Had a lovely walk to see an old friend who’s virtually housebound tonight. The sky was amazing. This was taken at about 8.45pm. Sign of the sun returning
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi SFGS29 yes mine was left side....it’s fairly straight forward....they ask you to hold your breath a few times (between 4 & 6 times)  each time they Zap you.  Good Luck Julie xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - DIBH technique

Posts.Content: Helsjw Not long to wait then, although it’ll feel like ages. Once you get your treatment plan & know what you’re fighting you’ll feel better.  Hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: Morning after diagnosis.....

Posts.Content: Hi Helsjw.  Sending big hugs   It can be terrifying at the beginning, waiting for results etc. I was where you are 6 months ago & now I’m just about to start back work (which I’m really nervous about) Do you have a Treatment plan yet?  Big Hugs  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Morning after diagnosis.....

Posts.Content: Hi Kaz18  Good Luck for tomorrow....the waiting is awful! I’m sure you’ll feel better once you have a treatment plan. You feel a bit more in control.  Big Hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: MRI results & surgery / treatment plan tomorrow

Posts.Content: Looking like I’ll be starting RT this month....Onc appointment on 12th June..... Julie xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Wow! What a day you’ve had! taralou  well ive has Zap no 5 today and never had this. My Radiotherapy Team always get me to give them my address and date of birth, I’m assuming to check they’ve got the right notes, do yours do that?   I wriggle/move my fingers when my arms are up and never had any problems. Sorry I can’t be more help hun.  Hope tomorrows better for you  julie xx
Posts.Title: Not 'lined up' No RT today - anyone else have this?

Posts.Content: Awww taralou bless ya....you’re really having a rough time with it!  I was a bit out of line yesterday but the 2 guys lifted the back of the bed up a touch and they’d forgot to lock the wheels lol but it was all sorted quickly. I hope the last 6 zaps go better for you.  Hugs julie xx
Posts.Title: Not 'lined up' No RT today - anyone else have this?

Posts.Content: My Daughter and her friend are doing one at my work today....there’s a few cakes with my name on......wages and waist line shot it this week Julie xx
Posts.Title: Macmillan Cake Day

Posts.Content: Thanks Dreamthief! I’ll check that out  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tubular BC

Posts.Content: Hi londongurl  I must admit I was ready to give up on them after a month! I can cope with hot flushes, insomnia & a bit of extra weight (at the minute! Lol) but I couldn’t cope with the mood swings!! I’d sit crying for no reason, biting people’s heads off, I felt absolutely crap! I started taking them at bedtime and almost 3 months down the line I feel better most of the time now, although I feel like I’m fighting the mood swings some days.   Wether you give them a try or not, you have to go with what feels right for you.  Good luck  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Refusing Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: So been for pre assessment this afternoon....found a few things out! I have Stage 1, a 25mm Tubular Breast Tumour! Er negative no other results back yet.  Breast nurse said Lumpectomy plus extra tissue to get clear margins and Sentinel Biopsy and the 3 weeks Radiotherapy. All pretty standard, apparently rare but treatable     Not going to look on Dr Google so taking her word for it lol Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tubular BC

Posts.Content: Eddiboy Haha! Rare cancer club, I like it lol.  Yea nurse said invasive but slow growing! So as long as I get clear margins and clear nodes next Thursday, it’s 3 weeks Radiotherapy and “get on with my life” as she put it haha!  Thanks and good luck you to    Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tubular BC

Posts.Content: Thank you @snuggles10 I actually felt better today than I have all week waiting to go for the results....even though the breast cancer nurse told me it was looking bad...it was the week waiting to see “how bad” that was the worse. I hope you you get your results quickly and everything’s ok  xx
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi Jo  Yes the nurse said she likes to be honest. I think my family and friends are more worried/upset than me. I had a cry at the hospital and then cried because I couldn’t get comfortable in bed because it hurt to lay on my left side, of all things   I’ve kinda resigned myself to expect bad news on Tuesday and I’m  okay with that (at the minute! Probably a mess by Tuesday lol) what will be will be, there’s not much I can do about it anyway ‍♀️  Thanks guys for the replies, very helpful. I’m sure I’ll be back with more questions, moans &  complaints in the very near future  Thank you xx
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi jo jo thank you for your kind words I’ll be thinking of you on Tuesday. I’ll pop a message on here to let you know how my appointment goes Tuesday!  Good luck for Tuesday Jo Jo xxx
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: @ask123 (sorry don’t know how to tag lol) Thank you   Wide Local Excision = Lumpectomy &  Sentinel Node Biopsy. Basically taking the lump out and lymph nodes. Yes I was quiet shocked at how fast it was but I suppose the quicker the better xx
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Thank you @Dreamthief  To be honest I had, the Breast Cancer Nurse prepared me well last week.
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi  I had a recall from a screening mammogram, went Tuesday and had a second mammogram, ultra sound, Breast biopsy and Lymph Node biopsy.  Went to see the nurse afterwards for my next appoint and she told me that my mammogram & ultrasound was a 5 (which apparently is not looking good) I was told by the time I came back for results my treatment plan would be in place, I was to bring someone with me because I would get bombarded with treatment plans & loads of information. Basically in a round about way saying I had cancer without saying saying the “C” word. Is this right? Can the tell if a lump etc is cancerous from the mammogram & ultrasound?  Thanks in advance   Ps sorry for the essay
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hey guys well just got back for clinic. I’ve been diagnosed with a 2-3cm cancerous lump in left breast...booked in to have WLE and SNB in 2 weeks time and then radiotherapy......the journey, all be it small, begins!
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Thank You @Mumof3plusoh Xx
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi there Thank you   Yes she explained the 1-5 scale and was talking me through what would happen this coming Tuesday and to make sure I bring someone with me because I wouldn’t take everything in.  My family that I’ve told seem to think it’s the worst case scenario she was giving me and that I could still be fine. Me personally I’m prepared for the worse by the way the nurse was talking to me.  I just wasn’t sure if this was the norm or I’d miss heard/understood her.  Yes I just want Tuesday to hurry up so I know where I stand.  Thanks for replying
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi  This is what I’ve said they know what they are looking for. Yes I’m wondering if I’ll have to have more test done. I’m not one for over thinking but I hate the waiting around lol i like to get on with things, I’m not the patient person to be honest.  Thanks for replying xx
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: @Weeblemum Thank You. Me too
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi Jackie Thanks for replying  Fortunately I dodged Chemo.  I start Radiotherapy in 3 weeks! I’m actually dreading starting these bloody tablets! My Daughter in law is a pharmacist and said “oh you’ll be fine on tamoxifen” errr have you been on them then??! Lol *smartass her*  Well here goes the tablets start now!  Thanks again Jackie Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen brands UK list? trying to find one that suits me!

Posts.Content: Hi All I’ve just picked my prescription up for Tamoxifen and I’ve got the Relonchem one....after reading these post I’ll be starting it tonight and keeping my fingers crossed.  How soon do SE start? Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen brands UK list? trying to find one that suits me!

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady56 Yes start 9th July.....compared to most I got off lightly, thank god!  Yes I’m gonna give one a ring Monday but till then I’ll go back to taking it before bed! I have found the RT thread yes and I’m gonna make the most of the sun until the 9th lol. In between the World Cup!  Thanks for replying Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hi Jill  Thanks for the reply  I’m gonna mention it when I next see oncologist. I’ve started taking them at night at the minute, low moods still there, but like it’s just under the surface, of that makes sense? I’m nowhere near as tearful as I was! Insomnia I can cope with! We’ve been friends for a while now lol.  Rads start on 9th July. I’ve heard they hit you after the first week! So I’m prepared to have plenty of me time, sick not doesn’t run out till 15th July and I can always get another one if I need it, I’m in no rush to go back until I feel well enough! That’s one thing that Breast Cancer has taught me.....Look after Number one!!  Thank You for your input and advice  Take care Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Julie xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hugs  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: For the Football Fans
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: I Love This! Julie xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hi Ange Thanks for replying . Even reading your reply made me fill up, that’s how bad I’ve got! Jeez I’ve not felt this crap in years! Must admit of all the side affects on the list this was the one I was dreading.   I’ll look through my paper work to find a number and give them a ring....I’ll give anything a try.  Thanks for the tips regarding rads! Nerves will go once I’ve had the 1st one.....it’s the unknown for me.  Thanks again Ange  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Something I still struggle with & feel guilty for doing!  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Julie xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Morning All  Woke up this morning and feel good! First time in just under a week! So I’m hoping night time tablets are working!! If not then it’s back Oncologist to see if I can do half & half.  Thanks all for your advice   Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hi June.  Thanks for replying. Yes I think when I get the next lot I’ll ask about splitting them. Night time are working out a bit better but feel like I’m fighting to keep on top of things.  Thank you  I’ve got that many creams in I could open a shop lol. Got E45 lotion, Aveeno lotion (the blue babies one lol) aloe Vera gel for if I burn. Loads of Simple shower and bath creme   think I prepared, well hopefully lol.  I’m so glad you’re 3 years down the line & doing good.  Take care  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Julie xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hey All Apologies if this is been discussed before. I started Tamoxifen just under 2 weeks ago and my mood has slowly been dropping to the point I couldn’t stop crying last night. The slightest thing makes me feel tearful.  I realise this is one of the SE but this quick? Or could it be reality has finally hit home for me as I had my Radiotherapy planning appointment on Thursday.  If it’s the Tamoxifen how likely is it to last?  Thanks  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hey Mandy  Nice to hear from you again. I got mine at my 1st Oncologist meeting, I did have nausea for a few days and then was fine. Thought I’d got off lightly, but the past few days been really down.  I’m gonna try taking them at bedtime as I was taking them in the morning so fingers crossed! & hopefully things will settle back down.  I had my Radiotherapy planning on Thursday just gone. Was all pretty straight forward, measurements, tattoo markers and practiced my breathing as mine was left side. I started Rads 9th July so 2 weeks to enjoy the sun before I have to cover up lol  Hope you’re doing well & things go well with your Oncologist meeting next week.  Bigs hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hey Ange I spoke to BCN and she suggested try taking them at bedtime, which I had started doing anyway. I’ll give it a couple of weeks and then I’ll se what oncologist says about the half and half.  I’ve got some of that Altruist suncream (ordered it Saturday and it came yesterday!) so thanks for that   Hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hey Ange To be honest I have to have a rant and moan on here or I’d go nuts! My friends seem to have dwindle away since being diagnosed, as much as I’ve tried to keep them up to date etc, if I don’t visit or text/ring then I don’t see or hear from them. I guess they were never proper friends anyway! We live and learn aye lol.  As for the Tamoxifen, feel like I’m on a slight (kiddies) rollercoaster lol. I do feel better but it’s bubbling under the surface. I think when this box runs out I’ll see if I can get 10mg or ask if I can split them. Until then I’ll keep fighting them lol.  Thanks again for everything  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hi cashyvj That’s what I’m hoping for, that over time things will settle down....I hate the low moods, slightest thing makes me want to cry, it’s awful.   I’m gonna give it a few months to see if things settle down and start taking them at bedtime now instead of mornings.  Yes I know what you mean about feeling ‘safe’ with them.  Thanks for replying  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hi Ange So far so good, the low moods are still there but I seem to be able to control them but I’m definitely gonna ask about splitting the tablet at next appointment a week on Monday!  It is a nice cream! At this rate with the weather I’ll have to order some more LOL this lot will be gone by the time I start rads lol.  Thanks again   Hugs  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Oh bless ya @earwig o How awful for you..... Gentle hugs for you  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Op postponed!!

Posts.Content: I used the Simple range, shower gel, bubble bath & soap. Also used Sanex extra sensitive bath foam and E45 daily lotion. I couldn’t get on with e45 cream, to thick and I ended up making my boob sore from tying to rub it in lol julie xx
Posts.Title: Shower gel and body lotion

Posts.Content: Thank you seaspirit44 I know deep down I being hard on myself but it’s nice to know it’s not just me.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Hi Spinningrose65  End of treatment seems to put us all out of sorts aye! I start back work Thursday on a phase return, 4 hours a day for 21/2 weeks and then another meeting to see how I’m feeling & coping. I’ve hated the fact that everyone keeps saying “you’re looking really well” when you feel like absolute crap!! I’m hoping going back to work will lift my mood and I’ll start to find the NEW normal  I hope you feel better soon. Bigs hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Thank You Leolady56  I just need to get my brain and body on the same page. Bit of an emotional wreck today.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Hey Denisa Thank you :) I’ll soon find out tomorrow if I can get any help! Even if I go back work next I’m still gonna be the same mess at the end of September as I  get paid monthly. So it’s going to be October before I have normal wages! And I live by myself so no one to fall back on.... Thank You for the reply  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Hi HClare Thank You   I expect they saw it as not bothering me....I know something I’ll be going back work with a different attitude as a lot of them “haven’t bothered” to keep in touch. I did feel guilty at the start of my diagnosis about the time off  as well lol. With regards to the phased return if I get a sick note from GP stating a phase return would that go in my favour? I have no annual leave apart from maybe a couple of days left.  I’m walking a lot and started swimming again last week to build my stamina up, 1st couple of times swimming absolutely wiped me out! I just didn’t expect to feel this knackered! Thanks again for the kinds works and suggestions with regards to work. Hugs  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Morning HClare  Yes I’ve had quite few that disappeared after my Op...work & friends. We live and learn aye.   I’ve got a Doctors appointment Tuesday morning (my sick note runs till Wednesday) so I’ll mention that at my meeting Friday with my line manager & HR. I know my manager isn’t going to be happy because I work the night shift and I can’t do reduced hours in the middle of the night cause of getting there and back.  Thanks again for the advice and support Clare Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Thank you LondonLass Deep down I know I’m being hard on myself and  I’m puttImg pressure on myself to get back to the old me, back to normal, back to work....I just don’t know what ‘normal’ is at the minute....I’m walkg a lot and going swimming to build my fitness back up but it’s wiping me out at the minute. I think work etc think treatments done so I should be up and running!  I think a trip back to GP is in order   Sunflower76  Thank You for the giggle, even though I was crying at the same time lol. Sounds like a good line to use “it’s the drugs!” I just don’t like feeling this way, I hate being out of control.  Aspen I never had Chemo so I think this is why im being so hard on myself,  that as I had it fairly easy I should be up and running and back to normal & this is the feeling I’m getting from work. I have an appointment at the Job Centre tomorrow to see if I’m entitled to any help, so hopefully that’ll be one thing of my mind. I also have a “keeping in touch” meeting Friday at work. I’ve been off work 4 months and not 1 phone call, message or meeting to see how I’m getting on, only now my sick note is up on the 5th....which is why I think they expect me to go back (it can be quite a physical job) I’m going to ask for a phase return on days as I work nights and don’t think I could do a full night shift.  Thank you all for you’re kind words (which made me cry) but i feel a bit better writing things on here  Hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Hi Moomc   Thank you   Very true, as sitting this side of phone/laptop you do feel alone and then you log on and realise where the support is. I think I’m going to suggest a phase return for a couple of weeks in the meeting tomorrow. I know my manager isn’t going to be happy but do I care! Yes my little infection has all cleared up now thank you. I’ve had more trouble & felt “ill” since end of treatment than when I first got diagnosed   Hope you’re feeling a bit better Mandy.  Hugs Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: 4 weeks out of RT, I’m still struggling with fatigue/tiredness (is this normal?) Low moods, insomnia various aches pains from Tamoxifen. Feel worse now than at Diagnosis!!  On top of all that work have put me on SSP (which I wasn’t aware they were going to do!) so stressed out having to sort housing benefits/Universal Credits etc & trying to keep my head above water    I’m most likely going back work Wednesday as feeling pressured from work anyway.  I dealt with the BC diagnosis & treatment really well, got on with things, did what I had to do & stayed the same bubbly me.....I now seem to be really struggling with everything now! I feel tearful all the time, the slightest thing makes me cry.  I know I’m being stupid and need to sort myself out! I need a good kick in the a$$!!  Sorry for the rant just needed to get it out my head.  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Moomc As we went through similar diagnosis, treatment etc I was going to message you to see how you were doing but felt silly....I’m soooo glad it’s not just me! Not that I’m glad you’re feeling crappy but like you I was wondering if there was something else going on.  My employer has ok to be fair up to now but I just get the feeling that they think I should be back.....I’ll see what they say Friday.....I must admit I am a bit apprehensive about going back as I don’t wanna let people down at work.  Thank you you so much Mandy  Hugs  Julie xx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!
